intro: Eriogonum cedrorum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and chaparral areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a rough, hairy texture. Eriogonum cedrorum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife in its native range.
